description: Eighty years ago a Portuguese consul gave visas to thousands fleeing the invading Nazis in France.
title: Portugal finally recognises consul who saved thousands from Holocaust
title_page: Portugal finally recognises consul who saved thousands from Holocaust - BBC News
maintext: "My father avoided big roads, gave Paris a wide berth and stuck to the coast. He wanted to be only 10 miles ahead of the front all the time, because he thought it could be a quick war and why go too far when you might have to go back?"
